document.title: The cross-polytope, the ball, and the cube

section.title: 1lq norms and volume of the unit ball

para.p:
For
∈
x , y
R n
,

Math.text: list@(x, y) = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(x _ j * y _ j)

para.p:
Let
e 1
, … ,
e n
be the standard basis for
R n
.

For
1 ≤ q < ∞
let

Math.text: (absolute-value@(x)) _ q = (((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((absolute-value@(x _ j)) ^ q)) ^ (1 / q)

para.p:
and for
= q ∞
let

Math.text: (absolute-value@(x)) _ infinity = (maximum _ (1 less= j less= n))@(absolute-value@(x _ j))

para.p:
Then for for
1 ≤ q ≤ ∞
let

Math.text: (B _ q) ^ n = conditional-set@(x element-of R ^ n, (absolute-value@(x)) _ q less= 1)

para.p:
For
0 ≤ k ≤ n
let
λ k
be
k
-dimensional Lebesgue measure on
R n
. We calculate the volume of the unit ball with the
ℓ q
norm for
1 ≤ q < ∞
.

For
≥ n 1
and for
1 ≤ q < ∞
,

Math.text: lambda _ n * (B _ q) ^ n = (2 * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ n / (Gamma * (n / q + 1))

para.p:
For
≥ R 0
let
=
⁢
V q
n
( R )
⁢
λ n
(
⋅ R
B q
n
)
. For
= n 1
,

Math.text: (V _ q) ^ 1 * R = lambda _ 1 * (R cdot (B _ q) ^ 1) = (integral _ (- R less= x _ 1 less= R))@(differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * x _ 1) = 2 * R

para.p:
By induction, suppose for some
n
that

Math.text: (V _ q) ^ n * R = (2 * R * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ n / (Gamma * (n / q + 1))

para.p:
Using Fubini’s theorem and the induction hypothesis and doing the change of variable
=
x
+ n 1
⁢ R t
we calculate

Math.text: (V _ q) ^ (n + 1) * R = (integral _ ((absolute-value@(x _ 1)) ^ q + cdots + (absolute-value@(x _ n)) ^ q + (absolute-value@(x _ (n + 1))) ^ q less= R ^ q))@(differential-d@(lambda _ (n + 1)) * x)
absent = (integral _ ((absolute-value@(x _ 1)) ^ q + cdots + (absolute-value@(x _ n)) ^ q + (absolute-value@(x _ (n + 1))) ^ q less= R ^ q))@(differential-d@(lambda _ (n + 1)) * x)

absent = (integral _ (- R less= x _ (n + 1) less= R))@((integral _ ((absolute-value@(x _ 1)) ^ q + cdots + (absolute-value@(x _ n)) _ q less= R ^ q - (absolute-value@(x _ (n + 1))) ^ q))@(differential-d@(lambda _ n) * vector@(x _ 1, ldots, x _ n)) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * x _ (n + 1))

absent = (integral _ (- R less= x _ (n + 1) less= R))@((integral _ ((absolute-value@(x _ 1)) ^ q + cdots + (absolute-value@(x _ n)) _ q less= R ^ q - (absolute-value@(x _ (n + 1))) ^ q))@(differential-d@(lambda _ n) * vector@(x _ 1, ldots, x _ n)) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * x _ (n + 1))
absent = (integral _ (- R less= x _ (n + 1) less= R))@((V _ q) ^ n * (R ^ q - (absolute-value@(x _ (n + 1))) ^ q) ^ (1 / q) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * x _ (n + 1))
absent = (integral _ (- R less= x _ (n + 1) less= R))@((V _ q) ^ n * (R ^ q - (absolute-value@(x _ (n + 1))) ^ q) ^ (1 / q) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * x _ (n + 1))

absent = (integral _ (- R less= x _ (n + 1) less= R))@(((2 * (R ^ q - (absolute-value@(x _ (n + 1))) ^ q) ^ (1 / q) * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ n / (Gamma * (n / q + 1))) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * x _ (n + 1))

absent = (integral _ (- R less= x _ (n + 1) less= R))@(((2 * (R ^ q - (absolute-value@(x _ (n + 1))) ^ q) ^ (1 / q) * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ n / (Gamma * (n / q + 1))) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * x _ (n + 1))
absent = ((2 * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ n / (Gamma * (n / q + 1))) * (integral _ (- 1 less= t less= 1))@(((R ^ q - (absolute-value@(R * t)) ^ q) ^ (n / q) cdot R) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * t)
absent = ((2 * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ n / (Gamma * (n / q + 1))) * (integral _ (- 1 less= t less= 1))@(((R ^ q - (absolute-value@(R * t)) ^ q) ^ (n / q) cdot R) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * t)
absent = (((2 * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ n / (Gamma * (n / q + 1))) cdot R ^ (n + 1) cdot 2) * (integral _ (0 less= t less= 1))@((1 - t ^ q) ^ (n / q) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * t)
absent = (((2 * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ n / (Gamma * (n / q + 1))) cdot R ^ (n + 1) cdot 2) * (integral _ (0 less= t less= 1))@((1 - t ^ q) ^ (n / q) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * t)

para.p:
Now, doing the change of variable
= u
t q
, namely
= t
u
/ 1 q
with
=
t ′
⁢
1 q
u
-
1 q
1
and using the beta function
=
⁢ B
( a , b )
∫ 0
1
⁢
u
- a 1
(
- 1 u
)
- b 1
d
λ 1
( u )
,

Math.text: (integral _ (0 less= t less= 1))@((1 - t ^ q) ^ (n / q) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * t) = (integral _ (0 less= u less= 1))@(((1 - u) ^ (n / q) cdot (1 / q)) * u ^ (1 / q - 1) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * u)
(integral _ (0 less= t less= 1))@((1 - t ^ q) ^ (n / q) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * t)
absent = (integral _ (0 less= u less= 1))@(((1 - u) ^ (n / q) cdot (1 / q)) * u ^ (1 / q - 1) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * u)
absent = (1 / q) * B * open-interval@(1 / q, n / q + 1)
absent = (1 / q) * B * open-interval@(1 / q, n / q + 1)

para.p:
But
=
⁢ B
( a , b )
⁢ Γ
( a )
Γ
( b )
⁢ Γ
(
+ a b
)
, and using
=
⁢ Γ
(
+ a 1
)
⁢ a Γ
( a )
,

Math.text: (1 / q) * B * open-interval@(1 / q, n / q + 1) = (1 / q) * ((Gamma * (1 / q) * Gamma * (n / q + 1)) / (Gamma * (1 / q + n / q + 1))) = (Gamma * (1 / q + 1) * Gamma * (n / q + 1)) / (Gamma * ((n + 1) / q + 1))

para.p: Therefore

Math.text: (V _ q) ^ (n + 1) * R = ((2 * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ n / (Gamma * (n / q + 1))) cdot R ^ (n + 1) cdot 2 cdot ((Gamma * (1 / q + 1) * Gamma * (n / q + 1)) / (Gamma * ((n + 1) / q + 1)))
absent = ((2 * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ n / (Gamma * (n / q + 1))) cdot R ^ (n + 1) cdot 2 cdot ((Gamma * (1 / q + 1) * Gamma * (n / q + 1)) / (Gamma * ((n + 1) / q + 1)))
absent = (2 * R * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ (n + 1) / (Gamma * ((n + 1) / q + 1))
absent = (2 * R * Gamma * (1 / q + 1)) ^ (n + 1) / (Gamma * ((n + 1) / q + 1))

para.p: which proves the claim. ∎

B 1
n
is an
n
-dimensional cross-polytope,
B 2
n
is an
n
-dimensional Euclidean ball, and
B ∞
n
is an
n
-dimensional cube.

Math.text: formulae@(lambda _ n * (B _ 1) ^ n = 2 ^ n / nfactorial, formulae@(lambda _ n * (B _ 2) ^ n = pi ^ (n / 2) / (Gamma * (n / 2 + 1)), lambda _ n * (B _ infinity) ^ n = 2 ^ n))

para.p:
using

⁢ Γ
(
+ n 1
)

and

⁢ Γ

3 2

2

section.title: 2Intersection of a hyperplane and the cube

para.p:
Let
∈ ξ
S
- n 1
and
∈ t R
, and define

Math.text: P _ (list@(xi, t)) = conditional-set@(x element-of R ^ n, list@(x, xi) = t)

para.p: In particular,

Math.text: xi ^ perpendicular-to = P _ (list@(xi, 0))

para.p: Let

Math.text: A _ xi * t = lambda _ (n - 1) * (P _ (list@(xi, t)) intersection (B _ infinity) ^ n) = (integral _ P _ (list@(xi, t)))@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ n) * x * differential-d@(lambda _ (n - 1)) * x)

para.p:
For
∈ ξ
S
- n 1
and
∈ t R
,

Math.text: A _ xi * t = (2 ^ n / pi) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(cosine@(t * r) cdot ((product _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((2 / (xi _ i * r)) * sine@(xi _ i * r * d * r)))

para.p: Then by Fubini’s theorem,

Math.text: (widehat@(A)) _ xi * tau = (integral _ R)@(A _ xi * t * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * t * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * t)
(widehat@(A)) _ xi * tau
absent = (integral _ R)@(A _ xi * t * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * t * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * t)

absent = (integral _ R)@((integral _ P _ (list@(xi, t)))@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ n) * x * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * list@(x, xi) * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ (n - 1)) * x) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * t)

absent = (integral _ R)@((integral _ P _ (list@(xi, t)))@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ n) * x * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * list@(x, xi) * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ (n - 1)) * x) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * t)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ n) * x * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * list@(x, xi) * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ n) * x * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * list@(x, xi) * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)

para.p: Now,

Math.text: 1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ n) * x = (1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ 1) tensor-product cdots tensor-product 1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ 1)) * x = ((product _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ 1) * x _ i)

para.p: whence, by Fubini’s theorem,

Math.text: (integral _ (R ^ n))@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ n) * x * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * list@(x, xi) * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(((product _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ 1) * x _ i * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * x _ i * xi _ i * tau)) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
(integral _ (R ^ n))@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ n) * x * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * list@(x, xi) * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(((product _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ 1) * x _ i * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * x _ i * xi _ i * tau)) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
absent = ((product _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ R)@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ 1) * x _ i * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * x _ i * xi _ i * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * x _ i))
absent = ((product _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ R)@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ 1) * x _ i * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * x _ i * xi _ i * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * x _ i))

para.p:
But, when
≠
⁢
ξ i
τ
0
,

Math.text: (integral _ R)@(1 _ ((B _ infinity) ^ 1) * x _ i * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * x _ i * xi _ i * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * x _ i) = ((integral _ (- 1)) ^ 1)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * x _ i * xi _ i * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * x _ i) = (1 / (pi * xi _ i * tau)) * sine@(2 * pi * xi _ i * tau)

para.p: thus

Math.text: (widehat@(A)) _ xi * tau = ((product _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((1 / (pi * xi _ i * tau)) * sine@(2 * pi * xi _ i * tau))

para.p:
By the Fourier inversion theorem, using that
^ A
ξ
is an even function,

Math.text: A _ xi * t = (integral _ R)@((widehat@(A)) _ xi * tau * e ^ (2 * pi * i * t * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * tau)
A _ xi * t
absent = (integral _ R)@((widehat@(A)) _ xi * tau * e ^ (2 * pi * i * t * tau) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * tau)
absent = (integral _ R)@((widehat@(A)) _ xi * tau * cosine@(2 * pi * t * tau * d * lambda _ 1) * tau)
absent = (integral _ R)@((widehat@(A)) _ xi * tau * cosine@(2 * pi * t * tau * d * lambda _ 1) * tau)
absent = 2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@((widehat@(A)) _ xi * tau * cosine@(2 * pi * t * tau * d * tau))
absent = 2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@((widehat@(A)) _ xi * tau * cosine@(2 * pi * t * tau * d * tau))
absent = 2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(cosine@(2 * pi * t * tau) cdot ((product _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((1 / (pi * xi _ i * tau)) * sine@(2 * pi * xi _ i * tau * d * tau)))
absent = 2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(cosine@(2 * pi * t * tau) cdot ((product _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((1 / (pi * xi _ i * tau)) * sine@(2 * pi * xi _ i * tau * d * tau)))
absent = (2 ^ n / pi) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(cosine@(t * r) cdot ((product _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((2 / (xi _ i * r)) * sine@(xi _ i * r * d * r)))
absent = (2 ^ n / pi) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(cosine@(t * r) cdot ((product _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((2 / (xi _ i * r)) * sine@(xi _ i * r * d * r)))

para.p:
Let
S
be the Fréchet space of Schwartz function
→
R n
C
and let
S ′
be the locally convex space of tempered distributions
→ S C
. If
: f
→
R n
C
is locally integrable and there is some
N
such that

Math.text: formulae@((integral _ ((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= R))@(absolute-value@(f * x) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x) = O * R ^ N, R to infinity)

para.p: it is a fact that

Math.text: formulae@(phi maps-to list@(f, phi) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(f * x * phi * x * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x), phi element-of S)

para.p: is a tempered distribution.

For
1 ≤ q ≤ ∞
and for
0 < h < n
,
| x |
q
- h
is a tempered distribution.

For
1 ≤ q ≤ 2
,

Math.text: (absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= (absolute-value@(x)) _ q less= n ^ (1 / q - 1 / 2) * (absolute-value@(x)) _ 2

para.p:
and for
2 ≤ q ≤ ∞
,

Math.text: (absolute-value@(x)) _ q less= (absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= n ^ (1 / 2 - 1 / q) * (absolute-value@(x)) _ q

para.p:
Then for
1 ≤ q ≤ 2
and for
0 < h < n
, using polar coordinates and as
=
⁢ σ
(
S
- n 1
)
⁢ 2
π
/
(
+ n 1
)
2
⁢ Γ
(
+ n 1
2
)
,

Math.text: (integral _ ((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= R))@(((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- h) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x) less= (integral _ ((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= R))@(((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2) ^ (- h) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
(integral _ ((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= R))@(((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- h) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
absent less= (integral _ ((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= R))@(((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2) ^ (- h) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
absent = (integral _ (S ^ (n - 1)))@(((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@((r ^ (- h) cdot r ^ (n - 1)) * differential-d@(r)) * differential-d@(sigma))
absent = (integral _ (S ^ (n - 1)))@(((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@((r ^ (- h) cdot r ^ (n - 1)) * differential-d@(r)) * differential-d@(sigma))
absent = ((2 * pi ^ ((n + 1) / 2)) / (Gamma * ((n + 1) / 2))) cdot ((integral _ 0) ^ R)@(r ^ (((- h) + n) - 1) * differential-d@(r))
absent = ((2 * pi ^ ((n + 1) / 2)) / (Gamma * ((n + 1) / 2))) cdot ((integral _ 0) ^ R)@(r ^ (((- h) + n) - 1) * differential-d@(r))
absent = evaluated-at@(((2 * pi ^ ((n + 1) / 2)) / (Gamma * ((n + 1) / 2))) cdot (r ^ ((- h) + n) / ((- h) + n)), 0, R)
absent = evaluated-at@(((2 * pi ^ ((n + 1) / 2)) / (Gamma * ((n + 1) / 2))) cdot (r ^ ((- h) + n) / ((- h) + n)), 0, R)
absent = O * R ^ ((- h) + n)
absent = O * R ^ ((- h) + n)

para.p:
For
2 ≤ q ≤ ∞
and for
0 < r < n
,

Math.text: (integral _ ((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= R))@(((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- h) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x) less= (integral _ ((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= R))@((n ^ ((- 1 / 2) + 1 / q) * (absolute-value@(x)) _ 2) ^ (- h) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
(integral _ ((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= R))@(((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- h) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
absent less= (integral _ ((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= R))@((n ^ ((- 1 / 2) + 1 / q) * (absolute-value@(x)) _ 2) ^ (- h) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
absent = n ^ (h / 2 - h / q) * (integral _ ((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= R))@(((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2) ^ (- h) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
absent = n ^ (h / 2 - h / q) * (integral _ ((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2 less= R))@(((absolute-value@(x)) _ 2) ^ (- h) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
absent = O * R ^ ((- h) + n)
absent = O * R ^ ((- h) + n)

para.p:
For
∈ ϕ S
let

Math.text: widehat@(phi) * xi = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(phi * x * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * list@(x, xi)) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)

para.p:
For
1 ≤ q < ∞
define
:
c q
→ R R
by

Math.text: formulae@(c _ q * z = e ^ (- (absolute-value@(z)) ^ q), z element-of R)

para.p:
which belongs to
⁢ S
( R )
, and let
=
γ q
^ c
q
.

For a tempered distribution
T
,

Math.text: formulae@(list@(widehat@(T), phi) = list@(T, widehat@(phi)), phi element-of S)

para.p:
Define
=
⁢
f
q , h
( x )
| x |
q
- h
. We calculate the Fourier transform of the tempered distribution
f
q , h
. 1 footnote 1 1 footnote 1 Alexander Koldobsky and Vladyslav Yaskin, The Interface between Convex Geometry and Harmonic Analysis, p. 9, Lemma 2.1.

Let
0 < h < n
. For
1 ≤ q < ∞
,

Math.text: (widehat@(f)) _ (list@(q, h)) * xi = (q / (Gamma * (h / q))) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(t ^ (n - h - 1) * ((product _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(gamma _ q * t * xi _ j * d * t))

para.p:
and for
= q ∞
,

Math.text: (widehat@(f)) _ (list@(infinity, h)) * xi = 2 ^ n * h * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(t ^ (n - h - 1) * ((product _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((sine@(t * xi _ j) / (t * xi _ j)) * d * t))

para.p:
Suppose that
1 ≤ q < ∞
. For
≠ x 0
, doing the change of variable
= z
⁢
t
/ 1 q
| x |
q
- 1
,

Math.text: ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(z ^ (h - 1) * e ^ (- z ^ q * ((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ q) * differential-d@(z)) = ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@((t ^ (1 / q) * ((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- 1)) ^ (h - 1) * e ^ (- t) * ((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- 1) * (1 / q) * t ^ (1 / q - 1) * differential-d@(t))
((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(z ^ (h - 1) * e ^ (- z ^ q * ((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ q) * differential-d@(z))
absent = ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@((t ^ (1 / q) * ((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- 1)) ^ (h - 1) * e ^ (- t) * ((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- 1) * (1 / q) * t ^ (1 / q - 1) * differential-d@(t))
absent = (((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- h) / q) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(t ^ (h / q - 1) * e ^ (- t) * differential-d@(t))
absent = (((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- h) / q) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(t ^ (h / q - 1) * e ^ (- t) * differential-d@(t))
absent = ((((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- h) / q) cdot Gamma) * (h / q)
absent = ((((absolute-value@(x)) _ q) ^ (- h) / q) cdot Gamma) * (h / q)

para.p:
i.e.

⁢
f

⁢

.

For
> z 0
define
:
F
q , z
→
R n
R
by

Math.text: formulae@(F _ (list@(q, z)) * x = e ^ (- ((absolute-value@(z * x)) _ q) ^ q), x element-of R ^ n)

para.p:
which is a Schwartz function. Doing the change of variable
= y
⋅ z x
and using Fubini’s theorem,

Math.text: (widehat@(F)) _ (list@(q, z)) * xi = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- ((absolute-value@(z * x)) _ q) ^ q) * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * list@(x, xi)) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)
(widehat@(F)) _ (list@(q, z)) * xi
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- ((absolute-value@(z * x)) _ q) ^ q) * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * list@(x, xi)) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * x)

absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(((e ^ (- (absolute-value@(y _ 1)) ^ q - cdots - (absolute-value@(y _ n)) ^ q) * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * list@(y, z ^ (- 1) * xi))) cdot z ^ (- n)) * differential-d@(lambda _ n) * y)

absent = z ^ (- n) * ((product _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ R)@(e ^ (- (absolute-value@(y _ j)) ^ q) * e ^ (- ((2 * pi * i * y _ j) cdot z ^ (- 1)) * xi _ j) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * y _ j))
absent = z ^ (- n) * ((product _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(gamma _ q * z ^ (- 1) * xi _ j)
absent = z ^ (- n) * ((product _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(gamma _ q * z ^ (- 1) * xi _ j)

para.p:
Then for

absent = (q / (Gamma * (h / q))) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(z ^ (h - 1) * list@((widehat@(F)) _ (list@(q, z)), phi) * differential-d@(z))

Math.text: formulae@(g ^ k * z = - kfactorial * binomial@(alpha, k) * z ^ (alpha - k), sgn * g ^ k * z = (- 1) ^ k)

para.p:
For
≥ n 1
, Faà di Bruno’s formula tells us

Math.text: (f compose g) ^ n * z = (sum _ (list@(vector@(m _ 1, ldots, m _ n), 1 cdot m _ 1 + cdots + n cdot m _ n) = n))@((nfactorial / ((m _ 1)factorial * cdots * (m _ n)factorial)) * (f ^ (m _ 1 + cdots + m _ n) compose g) * z)
(f compose g) ^ n * z

absent = (sum _ (list@(vector@(m _ 1, ldots, m _ n), 1 cdot m _ 1 + cdots + n cdot m _ n) = n))@((nfactorial / ((m _ 1)factorial * cdots * (m _ n)factorial)) * (f ^ (m _ 1 + cdots + m _ n) compose g) * z)

para.p: Then

Math.text: (- 1) ^ n * (f compose g) ^ n * z = (sum _ (list@(vector@(m _ 1, ldots, m _ n), 1 cdot m _ 1 + cdots + n cdot m _ n) = n))@((nfactorial / ((m _ 1)factorial * cdots * (m _ n)factorial)) * (exponential compose g) * z)
(- 1) ^ n * (f compose g) ^ n * z

absent >= 0

para.p:
This shows that
∘ f g
is completely monotone. Furthermore,
=
⁢
(
∘ f g
)
( 0 )
1
, so by the Bernstein-Widder theorem there is a Borel probability measure
μ
on
[ 0 , ∞ )
such that

Math.text: formulae@((f compose g) * z = (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(e ^ (- z * t) * differential-d@(mu) * t), z element-of closed-open-interval@(0, infinity))

para.p:
With
= α
q 2
, there is thus a Borel probability measure
μ q
on
[ 0 , ∞ )
such that

Math.text: formulae@(exponential@(- z ^ (q / 2)) = (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(e ^ (- z * t) * differential-d@(mu _ q) * t), z element-of closed-open-interval@(0, infinity))

para.p:
Then for
∈ z R
,

Math.text: c _ q * z = exponential@(- (absolute-value@(z)) ^ q) = exponential@(- z ^ 2 ^ (q / 2)) = (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(e ^ (- z ^ 2 * t) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t)

para.p:
For
∈ w R
we calculate, using the Fourier transform of a Gaussian,

Math.text: gamma _ q * w = (integral _ R)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * w * z) * c _ q * z * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * z)
gamma _ q * w
absent = (integral _ R)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * w * z) * c _ q * z * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * z)
absent = (integral _ R)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * w * z) * (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(e ^ (- z ^ 2 * t) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * z)
absent = (integral _ R)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * w * z) * (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(e ^ (- z ^ 2 * t) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * z)
absent = (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@((integral _ R)@(e ^ (- t * z ^ 2) * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * w * z) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * z) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t)
absent = (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@((integral _ R)@(e ^ (- t * z ^ 2) * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * w * z) * differential-d@(lambda _ 1) * z) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t)
absent = (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(square-root@(pi / t) * exponential@(- (pi * w) ^ 2 / t) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t)
absent = (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(square-root@(pi / t) * exponential@(- (pi * w) ^ 2 / t) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t)
absent = pi ^ (1 / 2) * (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(t ^ (- 1 / 2) * e ^ (- (pi ^ 2 * w ^ 2) / t) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t)
absent = pi ^ (1 / 2) * (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(t ^ (- 1 / 2) * e ^ (- (pi ^ 2 * w ^ 2) / t) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t)

From the final expression it is evident that

w 1
,

( 0 , ∞ )
, using the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality,

Math.text: logarithm@(gamma _ q) * square-root@((w _ 1 + w _ 2) / 2)
absent = (1 / 2) * logarithm@(pi ^ (1 / 2) * (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(t ^ (- 1 / 2) * e ^ (- pi ^ 2 cdot (w _ 1 / t)) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t))
absent = (1 / 2) * logarithm@(pi ^ (1 / 2) * (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(t ^ (- 1 / 2) * e ^ (- pi ^ 2 cdot (w _ 1 / t)) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t))
+ (1 / 2) * logarithm@(pi ^ (1 / 2) * (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(t ^ (- 1 / 2) * e ^ (- pi ^ 2 cdot (w _ 2 / t)) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t))
+ (1 / 2) * logarithm@(pi ^ (1 / 2) * (integral _ (closed-open-interval@(0, infinity)))@(t ^ (- 1 / 2) * e ^ (- pi ^ 2 cdot (w _ 2 / t)) * differential-d@(mu _ (q / 2)) * t))
absent = (1 / 2) * logarithm@(gamma _ q) * square-root@(w _ 1) + (1 / 2) * logarithm@(gamma _ q) * square-root@(w _ 2)
absent = (1 / 2) * logarithm@(gamma _ q) * square-root@(w _ 1) + (1 / 2) * logarithm@(gamma _ q) * square-root@(w _ 2)

para.p:
Because
↦ w

log
